name: instant
content:
instant

adjective
 
 
/ˈɪnstənt/
 
/ˈɪnstənt/
jump to other results
  1. ​
     
    [usually before noun] happening immediately synonym immediate
    • This account gives you instant access to your money.
    • The show was an instant success.
    • People today seem to want instant gratification.
    Extra Examples
    • She took an instant dislike to me, the first time we met.
    • There is no instant solution to the problem of rising crime.
    Topics Timeb2
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryverbs
    • be
    adverb
    • almost
    See full entry
  2. ​
     
    [only before noun] (of food) that can be made quickly and easily, usually by adding hot water
    • instant coffee
    3. Word Originlate Middle English: via Old French from Latin instant- ‘being at hand’, from the verb instare, from in- ‘in, at’ + stare ‘to stand’.
See instant in the Oxford Advanced American DictionarySee instant in the Oxford Learner's Dictionary of Academic English
Check pronunciation: instant

name: instant
content:
instant

noun
 
/ˈɪnstənt/
 
/ˈɪnstənt/
jump to other results
  1. ​[countable, usually singular] a very short period of time synonym moment
    • in an instant I'll be back in an instant.
    • for an instant Just for an instant I thought he was going to refuse.
    Extra Examples
    • For a brief instant, I thought she was going to fall.
    • He paused for an instant before continuing.
    • His news was too important to be contained for a single instant longer.
    • It was all over in an instant.
    • She woke up in the instant before the phone rang.
    Topics Timec1
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • brief
    • fleeting
    • given
    • …
    verb + instant
    • hesitate for
    • pause for
    preposition
    • at…instant
    • for an instant
    • in an instant
    • …
    See full entry
  2. ​[countable, usually singular] a particular point in time
    • at that instant At that (very) instant, the door opened.
    • the instant (that)… I recognized her the instant (that) (= as soon as) I saw her.
    • this instant Come here this instant (= immediately)!
    Extra Examples
    • The next instant she was flying through the air.
    • The bomb could go off at any instant.
    • At any given instant the distribution of molecular speeds is always constant under the same conditions.
    • He took out his keys to lock the door. At that very instant the door flew open and a man ran into the room.
  3. ​(informal)
    (also instant coffee)
    [uncountable] coffee that can be made quickly and easily by adding hot water
    • Do you want some coffee? Is instant OK?
    4. Word Originlate Middle English: via Old French from Latin instant- ‘being at hand’, from the verb instare, from in- ‘in, at’ + stare ‘to stand’.
See instant in the Oxford Advanced American DictionarySee instant in the Oxford Learner's Dictionary of Academic English
Check pronunciation: instant

name: instant message
content:
instant message

noun
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒ/
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒ/
(also IM)
[countable, uncountable]
jump to other results
  1. ​a written message sent using a system on the internet that allows people to communicate with each other very quickly
    • to send an instant message
    • Word spreads by email and instant message.
    Topics Phones, email and the internetb2
Check pronunciation: instant message

name: instant-message
content:
instant-message

verb
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒ/
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒ/
(also IM)
[intransitive, transitive]
Verb Forms
present simple I / you / we / they instant-message
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒ/
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒ/
he / she / it instant-messages
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒɪz/
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒɪz/
past simple instant-messaged
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒd/
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒd/
past participle instant-messaged
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒd/
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒd/
-ing form instant-messaging
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒɪŋ/
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒɪŋ/
jump to other results
  1. ​to send a written message using a system on the internet that allows people to communicate with each other very quickly
    • She spent most of the evening instant-messaging.
    • instant-message somebody He instant-messaged me last night.
    • instant-message somebody something Can you instant-message me the news?
    Topics Phones, email and the internetb2

content:
instant messaging

noun
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒɪŋ/
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪdʒɪŋ/
 [uncountable]
jump to other results

name: instant messenger
content:
instant messenger

noun
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪndʒə(r)/
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈmesɪndʒər/
jump to other results
  1. ​a computer program that allows one or more users to chat online using written messages that are sent and received quickly
    • When I’m away from home, I chat to my friends and family using an instant messenger.
Check pronunciation: instant messenger

name: instant replay
content:
instant replay

noun
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈriːpleɪ/
 
/ˌɪnstənt ˈriːpleɪ/
(British English also action replay)
[countable, uncountable]
jump to other results
  1. ​part of something, for example a sports game on television, that is immediately repeated, often more slowly, so that you can see a goal or another exciting or important moment again
    • Instant replays can occasionally prove the referee wrong.
    Topics TV, radio and newsc2
See instant replay in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: instant replay

name: action replay
content:
action replay

noun
 
/ˌækʃn ˈriːpleɪ/
 
/ˌækʃn ˈriːpleɪ/
 (British English)
jump to other results
  1. ​
    (also instant replay British and North American English)
     [countable, uncountable] part of something, for example a sports game on television, that is immediately repeated, often more slowly, so that you can see a goal or another exciting or important moment againTopics TV, radio and newsc2
  2. ​[countable] an event or a situation that repeats something that has happened before
    • It was an action replay of the problems of his first marriage.
Check pronunciation: action replay

name: IM
content:
IM

noun
 
/ˌaɪ ˈem/
 
/ˌaɪ ˈem/
(informal)
jump to other results
  1. ​
    (also instant message)
     [countable, uncountable] a written message sent using a system on the internet that allows people to communicate with each other very quickly; the system of sending these messages
  2. ​
    (also instant messaging)
     [uncountable] a system on the internet that allows people to exchange written messages with each other very quickly
